Misc

In addition, Aerodial has various useful features: Grouping components, buttons, event handling, importing/exporting a preset, etc.

{% endblock %} {% block content %}

Other components

Folder

Use addFolder() to add folders. You can add all types of components (except folders) to a returned folder just like adding them to the pane.

const aero = new Aerodial({
  container,
});

const f1 = aero.addFolder({
  title: 'Basic',
});
f1.addInput(PARAMS, 'speed');

const f2 = aero.addFolder({
  expanded: false,
  title: 'Advanced',
});
f2.addInput(PARAMS, 'acceleration');
f2.addInput(PARAMS, 'randomness');

Button

addButton() adds a button component. Use on() to handle click events.

var aero = new Aerodial();

const btn = aero.addButton({
  title: 'Increment',
}).on('click', function(value) {
  console.log(value);
});

Separator

addSeparator() is for adding a separator between components.

var aero = new Aerodial();
aero.addButton({title: 'Previous'});
aero.addButton({title: 'Next'});
aero.addSeparator();
aero.addButton({title: 'Reset'});

Events

Use on() of specific components to listen to its changes. Input components will emit change events. The first argument of the event handler is the input value.

var aero = new Aerodial();
aero.addInput(PARAMS, 'value')
  .on('change', function(value) {
    console.log(value.toFixed(2));
  });

If you want to handle global events (for all components), use on() on the pane for it.

var aero = new Aerodial();
aero.addInput(PARAMS, 'number');
aero.addInput(PARAMS, 'string');

aero.on('change', function(value) {
  console.log('changed: ' + String(value));
});

Import/Export

Aerodial has a feature for importing/exporting the current state as a JSON object. Use exportPreset() to export it.

var aero = new Aerodial();
// aero.addInput(PARAMS, ...);
// aero.addInput(PARAMS, ...);

var preset = aero.exportPreset();
console.log(preset);


		

	





To import an exported JSON object, pass it to importPreset().




	

		

			
var aero = new Aerodial();
// aero.addInput(PARAMS, ...);
// aero.addInput(PARAMS, ...);

aero.importPreset(preset);


		

		

			

			

		

	





If your pane contains parameters with the same name, specify presetKey to avoid conflicts.




	

		

			
var aero = new Aerodial();
aero.addInput(PARAMS1, 'speed');
aero.addInput(PARAMS2, 'speed', {
  presetKey: 'speed2',
});


		

		

			

			

		

	






Tips




Root title


title option of the pane creates a pane title. It can expand/collapse overall components including folders.




	

		

			
var aero = new Aerodial({
  title: 'Parameters',
});


		

		

			

		

	






Custom container


If you want to put place a pane into a specific DOM element, pass it as a container option of the pane.




	

		

			
var aero = new Aerodial({
  container: document.getElementById('someContainer'),
});


		

	






Custom label


You can set a label of components by using the label option.




	

		

			
var aero = new Aerodial();
aero.addInput(PARAMS, 'initSpd', {
  label: 'Initial speed',
});


		

		

			

		

	






Refresh manually


By default, Aerodial doesn't detect changes of binded parameters. Use refresh() to force-update all input/monitor components.




	

		

			
var aero = new Aerodial();
// aero.addInput(PARAMS, ...);
// aero.addInput(PARAMS, ...);

aero.refresh();
